conclusion: Use the ideal gas law PV = nRT to solve the problem.
Identify states from the cycle diagram: A is initial, B is final, C is intermediate.
Temperature at state A is T_0.
Calculate number of moles n_A at state A: n_A = (P_A V_A) / (R T_0).
Substitute T_A = T_0 into n_A equation: n_A = (P_A V_A) / (R T_0).
Calculate pressure P_A at state A: P_A = (n_A R T_A) / V_A.
Substitute values into P_A equation: P_A = (P_1 V_1) / V_1.
Calculate pressure P_1 at state A: P_1 = (n_A R T_A) / V_A.
Substitute values into P_1 equation: P_1 = (P_2 V_2) / V_2.
Conclude pressure at state A equals pressure at state B.
Calculate temperature T_C at state C: T_C = (P_C V_C) / (n_C R).
Substitute values into T_C equation: T_C = (P_2 V_2) / n_C.
Conclude temperature at state C equals temperature at state B.
Determine temperature of state C is T_C = T_B.
